016package edu.cnm.deepdive.zoomattendance.service;
017
018import android.annotation.SuppressLint;
019import android.content.Context;
020import android.content.Intent;
021import android.content.res.Resources;
022import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResult;
023import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultLauncher;
024import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
025import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignIn;
026import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount;
027import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInClient;
028import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInOptions;
029import com.google.android.gms.common.api.ApiException;
030import com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task;
031import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
032import edu.cnm.deepdive.zoomattendance.viewmodel.LoginViewModel;
033import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Completable;
034import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
035import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.SingleEmitter;
036import io.reactivex.rxjava3.schedulers.Schedulers;
037import javax.inject.Inject;
038import javax.inject.Singleton;
039
040/**
041 * Provides ReactiveX-integrated Google Sign In client flows for signing in, refreshing the bearer
042 * token, and signing out. This class is implemented as a singleton, and the implementation is
043 * thread-safe; however to minimize the risk of concurrency issues in the underlying Google Sign In
044 * client library, this class should be consumed by a single viewmodel (e.g.
045 * {@link LoginViewModel}).
046 */
047@SuppressWarnings("unused")
048@Singleton
049public class GoogleSignInService {
050
051  private static final String BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT = "Bearer %s";
052
053  private final GoogleSignInClient client;
054
055  @Inject
056  GoogleSignInService(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
057    Resources res = context.getResources();
058    @SuppressLint("DiscouragedApi")
059    int identifier = res.getIdentifier("client_id", "string", context.getPackageName());
060    String clientId = (identifier != 0) ? res.getString(identifier) : null;
061    GoogleSignInOptions.Builder builder = new GoogleSignInOptions.Builder()
062        .requestEmail()
063        .requestId()
064        .requestProfile();
065    if (clientId != null && !clientId.isEmpty()) {
066      builder.requestIdToken(clientId);
067    }
068    client = GoogleSignIn.getClient(context, builder.build());
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} that, when executed
073   * (subscribed to) refreshes the Google Sign In account credentials. This is of most use when a
074   * bearer token is needed to access a web service application; however, in most cases, the
075   * {@link #refreshBearerToken()} method is more convenient for that purpose.
076   *
077   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} configured for downstream execution in
078   * a thread pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
079   */
080  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> refresh() {
081    return Single
082        .create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) ->
083            client
084                .silentSignIn()
085                .addOnSuccessListener(emitter::onSuccess)
086                .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
087        )
088        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;String&gt;} that, when executed (subscribed
093   * to) refreshes the Google Sign In account credentials and bearer token. This is primarily of use
094   * when such a bearer token is needed to access a web service application. In fact, the result
095   * delivered to the subscribed
096   * {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer Consumer&lt;String&gt;} is suitable for use as
097   * the value of the {@code Authorization} header of an HTTP request.
098   *
099   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;String&gt;} configured for downstream execution in a thread
100   * pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
101   */
102  public Single<String> refreshBearerToken() {
103    return refresh()
104        .map(this::getBearerToken);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Sets the Google Sign In process flow in motion, using the specified
109   * {@link ActivityResultLauncher ActivityResultLauncher&lt;Intent&gt;} as a callback.
110   *
111   * @param launcher Callback provided (indirectly) by the requesting {@link android.app.Activity}.
112   */
113  public void startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher<Intent> launcher) {
114    launcher.launch(client.getSignInIntent());
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} that, when executed
119   * (subscribed to), completes the Google Sign In process flow. If sign-in is successful, the
120   * active {@link GoogleSignInAccount} is extracted from the provided {@link ActivityResult} and
121   * delivered to the downstream
122   * {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer Consumer&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;}
123   *
124   * @param result {@link ActivityResult} passed to the
125   *               {@link ActivityResultLauncher ActivityResultLauncher&lt;Intent&gt;} specified in
126   *               the invocation of {@link #startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher)}.
127   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} configured for downstream execution in
128   * a thread pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
129   */
130  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> completeSignIn(ActivityResult result) {
131    return Single
132        .create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) -> {
133          try {
134            Task<GoogleSignInAccount> task =
135                GoogleSignIn.getSignedInAccountFromIntent(result.getData());
136            GoogleSignInAccount account = task.getResult(ApiException.class);
137            emitter.onSuccess(account);
138          } catch (ApiException e) {
139            emitter.onError(e);
140          }
141        })
142        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Constructs and returns a {@link Completable} that, when executed (subscribed to), signs the
147   * current Google Sign In user from this app.
148   *
149   * @return {@link Completable} configured for downstream execution in a thread pool managed by the
150   * {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
151   */
152  public Completable signOut() {
153    return Completable
154        .create((emitter) ->
155            client
156                .signOut()
157                .addOnSuccessListener((ignored) -> emitter.onComplete())
158                .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
159        )
160        .subscribeOn(Schedulers.io());
161  }
162
163  @NonNull
164  private String getBearerToken(GoogleSignInAccount account) {
165    return String.format(BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT, account.getIdToken());
166  }
167
168}
